p.span: This afternoon Governor Pritzker extended the school closure mandate for the remainder of the school year because of COVID-19. This news is sad for our students, our staff and the entire school community. I would have never imagined this is how we would end the 2019-2020 school year and I am disappointed. I miss seeing our students in classrooms, hallways, and on our athletic fields every day. There are many questions you will have and, honestly, I have many questions too. As an administration we have many details to figure out in the coming days so we can communicate with you all. READ MORE......

br.p: Argo Community High School will be implementing their E-Learning Plan until further notice. For the attendance form and more details please follow this link.

p.strong: Need some extra information on COVID-19 and Social Distancing? Please read these articles:

strong.a: How to Help Your High School Senior Through COVID-19 Pandemic
NAMI: COVID-19 Resource and Information Guide

p.span: Due to the extension of the COVID-19 Social Distancing Guidelines we are canceling the Grad-Nite 2020 trip on May 16, 2020. There are two option for any students who have purchased grad nite tickets such as:

span.strong: Converting your tickets to “any day” tickets that you can use through the end of the 2020 season.
Voiding the agreement and refund your payments.

p.span: If you have purchased tickets ahead of time, please email Dr Toulios , Mrs. Dergance , or Mrs. Whittinghill

strong.span: FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM - FREE MEAL FOR 18 AND YOUNGER

br.p: Please pick up a bagged breakfast and lunch at Argo Community High School's Main Entrance Doors

span.p: 5:30 PM Cocktails | 6:30 PM Dinner | 8:30 PM Argo After Hours Gathering
Chicago Marriott Southwest in Burr Ridge

br.p: Tickets: $125 Per Person | $1,250 Per Table Click here for tickets and more information

strong.span: SUMMER SCHOOL REGISTRATION IS NOW OPEN

strong.a: Please click this link to register for classes.

br.p: Walk-in registration: If you choose to register in person, please be sure to fill out this brochure and bring cash or check to the bookstore between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 3:00 p.m.

All classes will be filled on a first come, first served basis. It is important to ENROLL EARLY because courses will be closed once registration reaches maximum size. In the event enrollment is insufficient, or staff unavailable, tuition will be refunded. Students who think they might fail a class are encouraged to enroll.

span.p: Please click on the different links for the latest Press Release from Argo Community High School.

strong.span: AMAZON SMILE - ARGO HIGHER EDUCATION FOUNDATION

span.p: Amazon Smile is a good way to get points/credit for Amazon purchases, from your Amazon account. Argo staff, parents and community members can have Amazon donate to the Argo Foundation just by making their own normal purchases through Amazon.

p.strong: Click here for more details | https://smile.amazon.com

div.div: Be sure to participate in the 2020 Census to shape your future! Click the image above or this link for more details!

div.p: Due to the extension of the COVID-19 Social Distancing Guidelines we are canceling the Grad-Nite 2020 trip on May 16, 2020. There are two options for any students who have purchased Grad Nite tickets such as:

ol.li: Converting your tickets to “any day” tickets that you can use through the end of the 2020 season.
Voiding the agreement and refund your payments.

div.p: If you have purchased Grad-Nite tickets ahead of time you will need to email Dr Toulios , Mrs. Dergance , and Mrs. Whittinghill so we can work with Great America to process one of these two options.

br.p: I again, understand your frustration on this situation ,and we are constantly working on preserving the safest and memorable experiences for you the class of 2020.
We ask that you remain positive and know that traditions do not fade away but are solidified with one single spark, which is YOU our Argo Seniors!

div.div: Student Council and Class Board elections

div.p: Now is the time to run for student council and class board elections. Find your Class Board class in Canvas to find the forms and requirements for running for office. You have until April 9th to put your name in the hat for elections.

It’s a new year, a new semester and a good time to change bad habits. If you are one of those students who is always late to 1st hour, or even occasionally late, we have a few changes that we are starting on Monday that might help to get you going a little earlier. Our goal is to make sure you are in your first hour class on time.

br.p: Starting Monday morning, all students who ride buses will be invited directly into the building, you will not be able to leave campus once you arrive on your bus. We encourage you to get your coffee and morning snacks in the cafeteria where lots of good stuff – including fancy coffees - are for sale.

And the second change is that if you arrive to Argo after 8:00am you will be asked to throw away any purchased food or drink before entering the building. So, set your alarm for five minutes earlier if you have to stop for a donut or coffee before you get to school.
